If at a certain time \\( t_1 \\), a different transformation \\( h(u) = u - k \\) is applied as an intervention, will the endpoint \\( u(T) \\) for T > t_1 depend only on the differential equation and not on the transformations applied?
Explanation: The intervention with \\( h(u) \\) again changes the state of the system, which due to the nonlinear differential equation affects the future state trajectory. The system's endpoint \\( u(T) \\) will depend not only on the governing equation but also significantly on the transformations applied at different times.
